revised_title: Effects of Self-Induction in Iron Cylinders: A Study of Current Density and Magnetic Induction
tldr: This study investigates the effects of self-induction in iron cylinders, examining the distribution of current density and magnetic induction. The research reveals that the current density is greater near the center of the cylinder, and the average relative densities vary between different areas of the cylinder. The results provide insight into the behavior of electric currents in iron cylinders and have implications for the design of electrical devices and systems.
